elements.text:
A random person comes up to you to ask you a question, but all you can manage in response is a quiet mumble they can't hear. You start wondering what their response will be.

Here are some feelings that might happen in the moment:

texts: I'm scared the person will yell at me.
I'm happy that I was at least able to talk.
I'm worried what the look on his face in response means, but I can get through this.
I'm worried that I might come across as rude, but I trust that the other person has enough patience not to immediately assume the worst.
I'm confident this person won't be rude to me in response.
